parameters.name: stream_name
parameters.description:
Optional stream name filter parameter.

This parameter is only used if `stream_type` is also provided.

parameters.name: alert_name_substring
parameters.description: Optional case-insensitive name substring filter parameter.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description:
The optional number of alerts to retrieve. If not set then all alerts
that match the query parameters will be returned.

parameters.name: page_idx
parameters.description:
The optional page index. If not set then defaults to `0`.

This parameter is only used if `page_size` is also set.

post.description:
Upload a zipped action file and process it.
This endpoint allows uploading a ZIP file containing an action, which will be extracted,
processed, and executed.

get.summary: list all keys for given org

200.description: list all keys in the org

get.summary: get key with given name if present

parameters.description: Name of the key to retrieve

delete.summary: delete key credentials for given key name

parameters.name: key_name
parameters.description: name of the key to delete

post.summary: update the credentials for given key

parameters.name: key_name
parameters.description: name of the key to update

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description:
Optional folder ID filter parameter

If neither `folder` nor any other filter parameter are set then this
will search for all dashboards in the "default" folder.

If `folder` is not set and another filter parameter, such as `title`, is
set then this will search for dashboards in all folders.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description:
The optional case-insensitive title substring with which to filter
dashboards.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The optional number of dashboards to retrieve. If not set then all
dashboards that match the query parameters will be returned.

Currently this parameter is only untilized by the API when the `title`
parameter is also set.

parameters.description: The short ID to retrieve the original URL

Location.description: The original URL to which the client is redirected

last_satisfied_at.description: Time when alert was last satisfied. Unix timestamp.

last_triggered_at.description: Time when alert was last triggered. Unix timestamp.

tz_offset.description:
Timezone offset in minutes. Negative seconds means the western
hemisphere

updated_at.description: Time when alert was last updated. Unix timestamp.

folder_id.description:
Optional folder ID indicating the folder in which to create the alert.
If omitted the alert will be created in the default folder.

data.description:
Base64 encoded string, containing all the data for a given view.
This data is expected to be versioned so that the frontend can
deserialize as required.

view_name.description: User-readable name of the view, doesn't need to be unique.

FolderType.description: Indicates the type of data that the folder can contain.

HttpResponse.description:
HTTP response
code 200 is success
code 400 is error
code 404 is not found
code 500 is internal server error
code 503 is service unavailable
code >= 1000 is custom error code
message is the message or error message

ListAlertsResponseBodyItem.description: An item in the list returned by the `ListDashboards` endpoint.

ListDashboardsResponseBodyItem.description: An item in the list returned by the `ListDashboards` endpoint.

alert_ids.description: IDs of the alerts to move.

dst_folder_id.description: Indicates the folder to which alerts should be moved.

dashboard_ids.description: IDs of the dashboards to move.

dst_folder_id.description: Indicates the folder to which dashboard should be moved.

scrape_interval.description:
Ideally this should be the same as prometheus-scrape-interval (in
seconds).

data.description:
Base64 encoded string, containing all the data for a given view.
This data is expected to be versioned so that the frontend can
deserialize as required.

view_name.description: User-readable name of the view, doesn't need to be unique.

is_external.description: Is the user created via ldap flow.

ViewWithoutData.description:
Save the bandwidth for a given view, without sending the actual data
This is expected to be used for listing views.
